headline: Thames Water Asks Castle Water, KKR for Detailed Equity Bids
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Castle Water Ltd. and KKR & Co. have been invited to provide more detail on their bids as the process for owning the debt-laden utility Thames Water progresses, according to people familiar with the matter. headline: Exclusive-KKR, Fountainvest and PAG among those eyeing Starbucks China stake, sources say
summary: KKR & Co, Fountainvest Partners and PAG are among buyout firms interested in acquiring a stake in Starbucks' China business, four sources said, as the U.S. coffee chain looks to revive flagging sales in its second-largest market.  Chinese companies, including state-owned conglomerate China Resources Holdings and food delivery giant Meituan, have also been approached as potential buyers, said one of the sources with knowledge of the matter.  Starbucks' executive vice president and chief financial officer, Rachel Ruggeri, is expected to be among senior company executives visiting China in the coming weeks to hold sale talks, said two of the four sources.

headline: Not Worried Private Assets Are Being Mismarked: KKR's Sheldon
summary: The lack of active trading in private credit makes it difficult to determine accurate prices, and different lenders may have different perceptions of a company's value, leading to disagreements...
